title: StageHound: The Next-Generation Online Platform for Fan Engagement
text:
Designed for guided and entertaining real-time experiences between influencers and their audiences, StageHound launches on Monday, October 12.
San Francisco, Calif. (PRWEB) October 12, 2015
Mark Cuban says he won’t hold an online Q&A session on Twitter because “I’m going to get 300 people calling me something stupid.” ¹
Conversations on reddit are “technically and visually daunting” to newcomers, and not very easy to use on smartphones. ²
Those experiences, and countless others, are the driving force behind the October 12 launch of StageHound , a beta-tested fan engagement platform that solves the major issues confronting influencers who want to authentically connect online with their fans and followers.
Backed by Silicon Valley angel investors, StageHound provides a safe and fun place for influencers and their fans to make personal connections, have genuine 1-on-1 conversations, and exchange ideas and synchronously share media content – all in a real-time social setting.
“Now more than ever, we are witnessing influencers attempting to connect with their fan base using social media channels, doing AMAs (Ask Me Anything) and Q&A sessions. Influencers’ desire to connect with fans is more popular than ever and growing fast,” said Matt Coalson, co-founder and head of product at StageHound.
Coalson continues, ”But using current tools makes it extremely difficult to have authentic, two-way conversations. There’s lots of distracting content, and interactions are confusing for both parties. They’re also generally not well-organized, causing people to feel left out and unheard. So we developed a real-time platform that captures the audiences’ attention, gets everybody involved and creates a memorable, high-energy entertainment experience.”
StageHound provides significant controls such as moderated, structured and organized interactions that promote the marketing agendas of influencers and brands while keeping sessions troll and spam-free. StageHound is also platform-agnostic and can be branded and sponsored to the promoter’s specifications.
Built and rigorously tested by gaming platform professionals, StageHound is specifically crafted to handle large numbers of concurrent users, and uses game mechanics to keep the audience actively engaged during the events.
In a typical StageHound event, questions are submitted, sorted, filtered and then voted upon by the fan community to ensure that the host can choose from the best ones. The format promotes structured 1-on-1 conversations while the rest of the participants can watch and interact with who's on center stage. Hosts can also showcase and share video and audio content – YouTube and SoundCloud for now – in a social setting where everyone is watching the same thing at the same time.
“StageHound is designed to be used by anybody, even those with zero technical proficiency,” CTO and co-founder Kabriel Robichaux said.
Several big names in entertainment and business are scheduled to host StageHound events following the official launch.
Press is invited to join a live demo with StageHound’s co-founder and product chief on Monday, October 12 from 11am-2pm ET / 8-11am PT at http://www.getstagehound.com
